meanings.definition: The quality or state of being without faults or defects.
meanings.sent1: Her faultlessness in completing the task impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: The faultlessness of the diamond made it highly valuable.
meanings.sent3: His faultlessness in always arriving on time became a running joke among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The faultlessness of her singing voice was like a crystal-clear stream flowing through the room.
meanings.sent5: The faultlessness of the painting left the art critics speechless.

meanings.definition: The act of being free from blame or error.
meanings.sent1: The faultlessness of his alibi convinced the jury of his innocence.
meanings.sent2: She handled the situation with faultlessness, avoiding any misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The faultlessness of his excuse for being late was met with raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: Her faultlessness in solving the puzzle was like watching a master at work.
meanings.sent5: The faultlessness of his memory amazed his classmates during the exam.
